column3: Ye look like one o' them adventurin' folk. Doin' a bit of explorin', are ye?
Me? I'm just yer run-o'-the-mill merchant, peddlin' me grog here in Aleport.
With all the ships what sunk durin' the Calamity, I feared me tradin' days were at an end. We managed to hold on somehow, though, an' brought the place back from the brink.
Hard times, it was. Thought I'd have to sell off the old family residence fer a while there.
Aleport? Well, it's a port...what deals in ale, mostly.
We do a modest trade in other goods, but seein' as Aleport has a lower tax on grog, it ain't hard to understand why all the liquor merchants come here.

We also get a lot o' tradin' vessels lookin' to stock up on our merry brew─water'll turn stale on a long voyage, ye see, so any captain worthy o' the name'll want a few barrels o' the good stuff loaded into his hold.
What kind of place is this?
